channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024020893
item.description:
Report X-2024020893

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found during unload phase. Wet, and was placed in lined hazmat tote and taken to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose caps cause inner container to leak and damage outer container. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in lined hazmat tote with orientation arrows up.

item.title: Report X-2024020121
item.description:
Report X-2024020121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/4/2024 at approximately 2145, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 749338 at the ramp facility in Phoenix, reporting a resin spill. The shipment consists of 4 metal cans, two of which sustained damage, causing the lids to pop off. This resulted in spillage onto other pacakges. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading process, the hazardous material had a soiled base causing for an inspection. Package was taken to hazmat cage. DescribePack: The cap caused an internal leak. Cap seal was attached to the cap. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazardous tote and bag and taken to hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet, then was brought to damage cage for further inspection around 7 am. DescribePack: Box was wet because one content had a loose cap, causing internal leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was separated from other packages, placed in an hazmat bag and tote for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024020435
item.description:
Report X-2024020435

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS SECURED IN A HAZMAT LINED BAG AND CLOSED DUE TO SMELL. THE PROPER VENTILATION WAS USED TO CLEAR TRAILER OF SMELL. THE PROPER PPE TOOLS AND SUPPLIES WERE USED TO SECURE THE HAZMAT. DescribePack: 1 BOTTLE OF THE OXIDIZER WAS LEAKING FROM OPEN CAP. THE OTHER BOTTLES WERE NOT LEAKING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put into a bag lined tote to secure leakage

item.title: Report X-2024020242
item.description:
Report X-2024020242

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was discovered on the dock with labels indicating the material was corrosive and was immediately bagged and sent to qa where it remained bagged and was processed with out any further spillage DescribePack: there is an opening near the top of the lid that has allowed fluid to exit but there is no cut or dent or other identifiable damage. again the amount leaked was very minor but remains on the top of the bucket DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: once it was discovered it was immediately put inside a double hazmat bag sleeve zip tied and transport to qa and placed in a sealed bucket.

item.title: Report X-2024020155
item.description:
Report X-2024020155

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: SCOTTSDALE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Jan 30th during the PM sort a pox was found leaking a white liquid substance. The package was not marked or labeled as dangerous goods. Upon opening the package two 1qt cans were found with one of them having leaked due to the lid coming off. Research into the product along with it being a PartA/PartB cand, as well as SDS from the MFG with similar part numbers leads us to believe this is a DG shipment. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being held for disposition.
